mil.emp3.mapengine.abstracts

Class CoreMapInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • mil.emp3.mapengine.abstracts.CoreMapInstance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMapInstance

    public abstract class CoreMapInstance
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMapInstance
    This class implements functionality that is common to all MapInstance classes that implement IMapInstance, currently known MapInstance classes are mil.emp3.worldwind.MapInstance mil.emp3.arcgis.MapInstance mil.emp3.openstreet mil.emp3.api.mock.MockMapInstance mil.emp3.api.RemoteMap.NoMap THIS CLASS SHOULD NOT BE USED TO CREATE STUB IMPLEMENTATIONS OF ALL THE METHODS IN IMAPINSTANCE. WHEN IMAPINSTANCE IS UPDATED WE WANT TO DETECT A COMPILATION FAILURE FIRST. AT THAT MOMENT YOU MAY DECIDE TO ADD A STUB METHOD IF YOU SEE IT FIT. IF YOU DO ADD A STUB METHOD MAKE SURE YOU CREATE A Log.wft clause, SO THAT YOU WOULD KNOW THAT UNIMPLEMENTED METHOD IS BEING CALLED. ADDITIONAL COMMON FUNCTIONALITY CAN BE PROMOTED BY USE OF GENERICS BUT WE WILL DO THAT IN A FOLLOW UP TICKET AS A RESULT OF THIS REFACTORING, class mil.emp3.worldwind.MapInstance, had to be modified to extend gov.nasa.worldwind.WorldWindow. This caused changes to Wall Paper Service.

      • getCapabilities

        public IMapEngineCapabilities getCapabilities()
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called by the EMP core to identify the map instances capabilities. It is used to ensure that the core does NOT attempt an operation on the map engine that it does not support.
        Specified by:
        getCapabilities in interface IMapInstance
        Returns:
        See IMapEngineCapabilities

      • addMapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener

        public void addMapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener mapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener)
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called by the core to register a Feature user interaction event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEvent each time the user performs any of the actions defined in UserInteractionEventEnum on a feature currently visible on the map.
        Specified by:
        addMapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener in interface IMapInstance
        Parameters:
        mapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceFeatureUserInteractionEventListener

      • addMapInstanceStateChangeEventListener

        public void addMapInstanceStateChangeEventListener(MapInstanceStateChangeEventListener mapInstanceStateChangeEventListener)
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called by the core to register a map state change event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceStateChangeEvent each time the map changes from one state (See MapStateEnum) to another.
        Specified by:
        addMapInstanceStateChangeEventListener in interface IMapInstance
        Parameters:
        mapInstanceStateChangeEventListener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceStateChangeEventListener

      • addMapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener

        public void addMapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener(MapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener mapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener)
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called by the core to register a map user interaction event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceUserInteractionEvent each time the user performs any of the actions defined in UserInteractionEventEnum on the map.
        Specified by:
        addMapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener in interface IMapInstance
        Parameters:
        mapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceUserInteractionEventListener

      • addMapInstanceViewChangeEventListener

        public void addMapInstanceViewChangeEventListener(MapInstanceViewChangeEventListener mapInstanceViewChangeEventListener)
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called by the core to register a map view change event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a MapInstanceViewChangeEvent each time the map's viewing area is changed. The map engine implementation must ensure that an excessive number of consecutive map view change events are not generated. I.E. continuous view change events due to animation should not be generated.
        Specified by:
        addMapInstanceViewChangeEventListener in interface IMapInstance
        Parameters:
        mapInstanceViewChangeEventListener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceViewChangeEventListener

      • addMapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener

        public void addMapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener featureAddedEventListener)
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called by the core to register a feature added event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a FeatureAddEvent each time a feature is added to the map using addFeature method.
        Specified by:
        addMapInstanceFeatureAddedEventListener in interface IMapInstance
        Parameters:
        featureAddedEventListener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceFeatureAddedEvent

      • addMapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener

        public void addMapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener(MapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener featureRemovedEventListener)
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called by the core to register a feature removed event listener. The core will call this once and only once upon starting the map instance. The listener registration MUST be destroyed when the onDestroy call is made. The Map instance MUST generate a FeatureRemovedEvent each time a feature is removed from the map using removeFeature method.
        Specified by:
        addMapInstanceFeatureRemovedEventListener in interface IMapInstance
        Parameters:
        featureRemovedEventListener - The object that implements the appropriate listener see MapInstanceFeatureRemovedEvent

      • registerMilStdRenderer

        public void registerMilStdRenderer(IMilStdRenderer oRenderer)
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called by the core to register a MilStd renderer with the map instance. The instance must call this renderer to obtain the basic shapes of a MilStd feature.
        Specified by:
        registerMilStdRenderer in interface IMapInstance
        Parameters:
        oRenderer - see IMilStdRenderer

      • getCapture

        public void getCapture(IScreenCaptureCallback callback)
        Description copied from interface: IMapInstance
        This method is called to retrieve an image of the current viewing area of the map.
        Specified by:
        getCapture in interface IMapInstance
        Parameters:
        callback - An implementation of the IScreenCaptureCallback interface. The EMP core ensures that this parameter is not null. Therefore a map engine implementation does not need to check for null. Any exception generated during the process must invoke the failure callback with the exception as the parameter. Upon success the map implementation must call the success callback with the ICapture object.
